data.title: Do in LA for Seniors (Trips, Beaches, Food, Parks & More)
data.meta_description: Ready to unlock the hidden treasures of LA? Our blog on 'Things to Do in LA for Seniors' is your ultimate guide to an unforgettable adventure in the City of Angels.
data.text:
Everyone knows about LA, but most people don’t know it is a multi-generational place offering too many activities, particularly for the increasing population of seniors.

This article will explore the best things to do in LA for seniors, including senior-friendly day trips, tours, recreational parks, beaches, food spots, cultural experiences, and much more.

So Get Ready to be dazzled by the magic of Tinseltown, the breathtaking views of the Griffith Observatory, and the vibrant energy of Downtown.

What LA Offers For Seniors?

LA has everything for you. – rest of your seniorhood here, you will never be bored in Los Angeles.

Besides the increasing population of senior communities, LA’s ideal weather with low humidity and temperatures (neither too hot nor too cold) – makes it a favorite place among seniors to live young, with many recreational activities and facilities of private care for elderly at home.

Whatever the reason, one thing is for sure: you will experience the most fun you have had in years here, in the largest city in California!

From world-class museums and art galleries to mouth-watering cuisine, recreational mountains to beaches, and diverse cultures to trendy nightlife, here are the top things to do in LA for seniors while you are there!

Let’s categorize them!

Senior-Friendly Day Trips & Tours

Beautiful Parks & Accessible Elder Adventures

Best Beaches for Seniors in Los Angeles

LA’s Senior Food Spots

Art, Culture & Museums

Senior Day Trips For The Young At Heart (Experience the Best of Los Angeles)

Looking to explore the surrounding areas of Los Angeles? Many senior activities in Los Angeles and senior-friendly day trips are listed below.

From visiting the historic Mission Capistrano to taking off on a ghost-hunting tour in Chinatown, these trips offer a little slower pace and have plenty of places for seniors to visit, sit and relax while taking in the scenery.

Let’s discover them one by one!

Simple & Beautiful Train Trip On The Pacific Surfliner

Mission Capistrano (A Good Choice For A Senior-Friendly Day Trip)

Weekend Trip To Old Town District In Orange County, California

Tour To Haunted Pasadena To Discover the Sordid Side Of LA

The Haunt LA: Chinatown Ghost Hunting Tour

Experience Creepy Tales Vibes At Haunted Hollywood

Walking Tour To The Official Hollywood Sign

Griffith Observatory Hike Tour Via The Hollywood Hills

Walking Tour In Old & New Downtown LA To Feel The Change

Explore the Historic Olvera Street

Heritage Valley Day Trip – Take a Sunday Drive

Richard Nixion Library

Simple & Beautiful Train Trip On The Pacific Surfliner

Are you a train lover? Yes! then Get ready for a scenic train trip along the California coastline on the iconic Pacific Surfliner – she will take you on a thrilling ride to the City of Angels.

On this popular Amtrak route, you can enjoy breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean, lush valleys, and picturesque towns.

You can explore Southern California’s beautiful coastal cities at your leisure, with various stops along the way. Popular Stops are:

Mission San Juan Capistrano

San Clemente Pier

Old Town San Diego

State Street Santa Barbara

Onboard snack bars and bathrooms make the train convenient for you and your loved one, so backpack to the Los Angeles Pacific Surfliner Train trip like no other, where scenic vistas, laid-back vibes, and a touch of Hollywood glamour await you along the way.

Mission Capistrano (A Good Choice For A Senior-Friendly Day Trip)

Step into the Past at Mission San Juan Capistrano (founded over 200 years ago ), the Birthplace of Orange County, where California’s rich multicultural history comes to life!

Explore the mission complex’s beautiful gardens and historic buildings, including the Serra Chapel (the oldest building in California), with plenty of nearby dining and shopping opportunities in San Juan Capistrano.

You can also witness the famous swallows (who migrate thousands of miles from winter homes to San Juan Capistrano) that return to the mission each year on March 19th.

Tour buses and almost hourly train service (Pacific Surfliner) make getting to Mission San Juan Capistrano easy and a must-visit destination for you traveling to Southern California.

Weekend Trip To Old Town District In Orange County, California

Planning a trip to the Old Town District in Orange County is perfect for you if you are seeking a change of pace from the bustling city.

This charming historic Old Town District features beautiful architecture, unique shops, and delightful restaurants, making it an ideal destination for a relaxing weekend with friends and family.

Now let’s add some haunted and creepy vibes places to the list – as you know, LA is famous for that!

Tour To Haunted Pasadena To Discover the Sordid Side Of LA

Tour to Haunted Pasadena lets you dig into this attractive city’s darker side. Guided tours are available to reveal chilling tales of murder, mystery, and paranormal activity while showcasing Pasadena’s most haunted locations.

The Haunt LA: Chinatown Ghost Hunting Tour

For seniors interested in a unique experience, The Chinatown Ghost Hunting Tour offers a thrilling adventure.

Armed with ghost-hunting equipment, you will explore the historic neighborhood while learning about its haunted past and seeking out supernatural activity.

Experience Creepy Tales Vibes At Haunted Hollywood

If you are interested in the spooky side of Hollywood, different haunted tours offer a thrilling experience.

These guided tours take you through the city’s most notorious haunted locations, sharing spine-chilling stories and infamous ghost sightings along the way.

Moving forward, let’s talk about some obvious mentions to visit in LA for seniors and all.

Walking Tour To The Official Hollywood Sign

World famous Hollywood’s iconic symbol of the entertainment industry is located atop Mount Lee in the Hollywood Hills. A walking tour of the official Hollywood Sign is a must-do activity for you as a senior visiting Los Angeles.

You can choose from various guided tours that provide fascinating insights into the history of the sign and the city’s film industry.

Griffith Observatory Hike Tour Via The Hollywood Hills

Please Take the opportunity to explore the beautiful Hollywood Hills while enjoying panoramic views of Los Angeles.

The Griffith Observatory tour offers you the senior-friendly hike leading to the famous observatory, featuring fascinating exhibits on astronomy and space exploration and stunning views of the city below. Don’t miss it!

Walking Tour In Old & New Downtown LA To Feel The Change

Schedule a good day with your soulmate for a walking tour of Downtown LA to experience the contrast between the city’s historical and modern areas.

As you explore the vibrant streets, you can appreciate the unique blend of old and new architecture, sample diverse cuisine, and learn about the city’s rich history.

Now jumping over to some beautiful historic places best for you to visit next!

Explore the Historic Olvera Street

If you are ever in downtown Los Angeles, be sure to check out Olvera Street, located adjacent to Union Station. It’s a landmark that has managed to retain its authentic charm, giving you a glimpse of what LA used to look like years ago.

You will find a traditional Mexican-style plaza with 27 historic buildings, including the Avila Adobe, built in 1818, which was once the residence of Francisco Avila, one of the city’s early mayors.

Olvera Street is a popular stop for many tour buses, so it’s definitely worth a visit if you’re interested in experiencing the city’s rich history and culture.

Heritage Valley Day Trip – Take a Sunday Drive

If you are looking for a scenic drive on a Sunday, consider taking State Route 126, which connects Santa Clarita to Ventura. This highway runs alongside the Santa Clara River, offering beautiful views of Heritage Valley along the way.

There are several points of interest to explore on the route, such as Bennets Honey Farm, Fillmore Railway, and the historic town of Santa Paula.

To make the most of your trip, be sure to allocate plenty of time to enjoy all of these attractions at Heritage Valley.

Richard Nixion Library

Explore the birthplace of President Nixon and pay your respects at his final resting place – just steps apart! History comes to life inside the library as you journey through the main gallery and its many exhibits.

With a recent $15 million renovation, the Richard Nixion Library now offers nearly 70 fascinating exhibitions, including a replica of Nixon’s Oval Office and an extensive display of his groundbreaking trip to China.

Don’t miss your chance to be a part of history there – plan your visit!

Our next list is all about LA’s famed amusement parks and Exposition Park, calling you to unleash your inner adventure there!

Parks & Accessible Adventures – Where To Go In LA With Grandparents In Tow

From peaceful strolls to thrilling outdoor activities, our curated selection of accessible adventures ensures you can enjoy nature’s beauty and create memories that will last a lifetime!

Excited to explore the amazing senior-friendly amusement parks and accessible adventures waiting for you in Los Angeles? Here are the best ones!

Disneyland Resort – Where Unforgettable Memories Are Made!

Six Flags Magic Mountain

Knott’s Berry Farm

Exposition Park, LA, Califonia

Runyon Canyon Park

Elysian Park Trail

LA Arboretum & Botanic Garden

Roses Sherman Gardens

Disneyland Resort – Where Unforgettable Memories Are Made!

With two theme parks, three hotels, and the Downtown Disney District, the Resort offers endless adventure, entertainment, and dining opportunities.

It is a magical destination for seniors and their families, so get ready for an unforgettable adventure of a lifetime – Disneyland Resort has something for everyone.

Don’t miss your chance to experience the magic of Disneyland Resort – plan to visit and make memories that will last a lifetime!

Six Flags Magic Mountain

Calling all thrill, Six Flags Magic Mountain is waiting for you!

With over 100 heart-pumping rides, including 19 world-class roller coasters, this park is a must-visit for seniors seeking fun and adventure, be ready for the ultimate thrill-seeking adventure there.

But don’t worry – there are plenty of other soft options too, from gentle rides to walking tours. Plus, with special discounts and accommodations for seniors at Six Flags Magic Mountain , there is no better time to visit next.

Knott’s Berry Farm

Looking for an exciting and memorable day out? Knott’s Berry Farm is the perfect destination for you.

With over 165 thrilling rides and a classic Old West theme, Knott’s Berry Farm offers a unique blend of thrills and history that will leave you in awe.

From the iconic Ghost Town to the jaw-dropping roller coasters, Knott’s Berry Farm also hosts seasonal events like the Boysenberry Festival and Knott’s Scary Farm, providing unique experiences throughout the year.

More energy left? Let’s have a look at the best things to do for you in Exposition Park, LA, Califonia.

Exposition Park, LA, Califonia

Get ready to explore the heart of Los Angeles at Exposition Park – a vibrant hub of museums, gardens, and iconic landmarks, making it the best place for seniors in LA.

With a rich history dating back to the 1870s, this 160-acre park offers a unique blend of natural beauty and urban excitement, making it the perfect destination for you.

You have the opportunity to explore other breathtaking spots within the Exposition Park, such as:

Concrete Hand and Footprints of Actors

Ready to leave your own mark on Hollywood history? Visit the famous concrete hand and footprints of actors – where every step is a step through Tinseltown’s iconic past!

Take the opportunity to get up close and personal with the famous prints of stars like Marilyn Monroe, Tom Hanks, and more. Get to know the insider knowledge and fascinating stories about each print and the legendary actors who forever left their mark on Hollywood.

Samuel Oschin Air and Space Center

Calling all seniors with a passion for flight! Prepare to soar through history at the Samuel Oschin Air and Space Center.

With cutting-edge exhibits and state-of-the-art technology, you’ll journey through aviation’s past, present, and future.

Don’t miss your chance to explore – so when are you planning to visit there?

Hoose Library of Philosophy

This stunning library houses a unique collection of philosophical works that will transport you to another time and place.

With comfortable seating and a peaceful ambiance, the Hoose Library is the perfect destination for seniors seeking a moment of tranquility and reflection of intellectual discovery and inspiration!

Banc of California Stadium

The premier destination for seniors seeking an unforgettable event in Los Angeles!

With a state-of-the-art facility designed for maximum accessibility, every seat is the best seat in the house. Don’t miss your chance to witness the excitement and energy of this iconic stadium.

So are you ready to cheer on your favorite team or enjoy a world-class concert experience at Banc of California Stadium?

Here now, adding some more amazing recreational parks of LA for you to visit must.

Runyon Canyon Park

Want to escape from the hustle and bustle of the city? Explore the breathtaking beauty of Runyon Canyon Park – the perfect outdoor oasis for seniors.

With stunning panoramic views of Los Angeles, various hiking trails, and unique wildlife sightings, Runyon Canyon Park offers an unforgettable outdoor experience that will leave you feeling energized and refreshed.

Don’t miss out on this must-see destination!

Elysian Park Trail

Step into a natural beauty and adventure world with Elysian Park Trail – the perfect destination for seniors seeking an exciting outdoor experience.

Nestled in the heart of Los Angeles, this hidden gem offers breathtaking views of the city’s skyline, hiking trails, picnic areas, and more.

Whether you want to relax in nature or get your heart pumping with an invigorating hike, Elysian Park Trail is a must-visit place in LA for you.

If you love flowers and gardens, the following spots are for you.

LA Arboretum & Botanic Garden

Ready to escape to a natural oasis of breathtaking beauty?

Discover the wonders of LA Arboretum & Botanic Garden – the perfect destination for seniors seeking a serene and immersive outdoor experience.

With guided tours tailored to your needs and special amenities like shuttle service and wheelchair rentals, you will have everything you need to explore 127 acres of lush gardens and tranquil forests.

You can enjoy leisurely strolls through the gardens, attend workshops, and explore the historic structures at the LA Arboretum.

Roses Sherman Gardens

Immerse yourself in the captivating beauty of Sherman Gardens’ Roses exhibit – the perfect activity for seniors in LA for a serene outdoor experience.

Take a peaceful stroll through the stunning rose garden, featuring over 200 varieties of the world’s most beloved flowers.

With easy accessibility and senior-friendly pathways at Sherman Gardens, this vibrant botanical oasis is ideal for unwinding and reconnecting with nature.

Who doesn’t love beaches? Everyone does! Here listed the stunning beaches (keeping LA’s seniors in mind) for you to sit, relax and absorb the shiny waves of water.

Sun, Sand & Senior Bliss: Discover The Best Senior-Friendly Beaches in LA

Discover yourself at the beautiful beaches of Los Angeles and bask in the sun, sand, and surf!

Our curated selection of senior-friendly beaches will joy you whether you seek relaxation or adventure.

From the iconic Santa Monica Pier to the tranquil shores of Malibu, visiting these beaches is the finest thing to do in LA for seniors which are accessible, scenic, and unforgettable.

So grab the sunscreen and go for a beach adventure you will cherish for years!

Will Rogers State Beach, Pacific Palisades

Redondo Beach

Manhattan Beach Pier

Leo Carillo State Park

Will Rogers State Beach, Pacific Palisades

Looking for a peaceful beach escape?

Will Rogers State Beach in Pacific Palisades offers stunning ocean views, soft sand, and a relaxing atmosphere that’s perfect for seniors.

Enjoy a leisurely stroll, bask in the sun, or take a dip in the Pacific – our beachside retreat is the perfect way to unwind and experience the beauty of California’s coast.

The Will Rogers State Beach offers easy access, ample parking, and facilities, making it a convenient option for seniors and their families. So have a get-together there for an unforgettable day at the beach!

Redondo Beach

Escape to the picturesque shores of Redondo Beach – the perfect senior-friendly destination to soak up the sun, relax and rejuvenate, and create lasting memories in a stunning coastal paradise!

Redondo Beach offers a vibrant coastal experience with a lively pier, dining options, and stunning ocean views. The beach’s gentle waves and wide sandy shores make it an ideal spot for a relaxing day by the sea. Mark it for your next destination!

Manhattan Beach Pier

Another popular destination for you if you are seeking a scenic beach experience. The pier features a small aquarium, picturesque views of the ocean, and nearby dining options.

Come and savor the beauty of the Manhattan Beach Pier – the perfect destination for seniors seeking a peaceful stroll, breathtaking ocean views, and a chance to create lasting memories with loved ones.

Leo Carillo State Park

Leo Carrillo State Park – an outdoor paradise waiting to be discovered by you.

With its pristine beaches, fascinating tide pools, and stunning coastal vistas, this park offers an unforgettable outdoor adventure for all.

Whether you are seeking a peaceful hike, a refreshing swim, or a picturesque picnic spot, with accessibility features designed to meet different mobility needs, seniors can explore the Leo Carillo State Park safely and comfortably.

Don’t miss out on this hidden gem – plan your visit and experience the natural wonders of Leo Carrillo State Park!

Now an alert first – You are going to be hungry for sure! Here we are going to mention the best foody places for you in LA to tantalize your taste buds.

Dining Out in Style at LA’s Senior Food Destinations & Spots

Calling all foodies! Discover the mouth-watering flavors of LA’s vibrant culinary scene with our senior-friendly guide to the city’s must-visit food places and eateries – let your taste buds run wild!

The Original Farmers Market

Grand Central Market

Little Tokyo

The Original Farmers Market

Looking for a taste of LA’s vibrant culture and history? Look no further than, The Original Farmers Market (the city’s beloved open-air marketplace for over 85 years), where fresh produce, gourmet foods, and unforgettable memories are always in season.

With over 100 merchants, you can explore a variety of offerings, including organic produce, handcrafted sweets, and international cuisine.

Whether you are a local or a visitor, The Original Farmers Market promises to be a delightful sensory experience that will transport you to a bygone era.

This place promises a delicious adventure you won’t want to miss! So plan your calendar then!

Grand Central Market

With over 100 years of history and more than 30 food vendors serving delicious dishes worldwide, this iconic marketplace is a must-visit destination for seniors.

Step into the vibrant and bustling Grand Central Market, savor LA flavors and indulge in everything from artisanal cheeses to traditional Mexican cuisine.

Whether you are a foodie or simply looking for a unique experience, the Grand Central Market promises to delight your senses and leave you with a lasting impression.

So don’t miss out on this unforgettable culinary journey – visit Grand Central Market!

Little Tokyo

Foodies, prepare for an exciting culinary adventure in Little Tokyo, Los Angeles!

This vibrant cultural hub offers a wide range of authentic Japanese dishes, from delicious sushi and sashimi to savory ramen and tasty street snacks.

With its friendly atmosphere and rich flavors, Little Tokyo is the perfect destination for seniors looking to explore new tastes and savor traditional delicacies.

Don’t miss out on this unique food experience – plan a visit for a mouthwatering journey through Little Tokyo today!

Moving on to the next section for you, which is History, Art & Culture.

Rediscovering History, Art & Culture: Tailored for Seniors

Discover the fascinating stories of our past, the beauty of art, and the richness of cultures are the best activities for seniors in Los Angeles. With our tailored History, Art & Culture section for you, so you can easily rediscover the history and cultures of Los Angeles – where every street corner is a canvas of creativity, and every step is a journey through time!

Los Angeles County Museum of Art

Skirball Cultural Center

Los Angeles Arts District

California Science Museum

The Autry Museum of the American West

Getty Villa & Getty Center

Los Angeles County Museum of Art

Unleash your inner art enthusiast at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA) – where masterpieces come to life and imagination knows no bounds!

As a senior, immerse yourself in a world of creativity and inspiration, where cultural treasures and contemporary art blend seamlessly to create a truly unique experience.

With exclusive discounts on admission tickets, you can explore LACMA’s expansive collections at your own pace and even join guided tours and workshops to deepen your appreciation for the arts.

Skirball Cultural Center

Explore the ultimate cultural experience at Skirball Cultural Center – a haven of art, history, and creativity.

With exhibits and events catering to seniors, you’ll explore the best in art, music, and theater. Our center offers the perfect opportunity to explore the rich cultural heritage of Los Angeles and beyond.

Immerse yourself in the vibrant energy of Skirball Cultural Center – a truly unique and unforgettable experience that will leave you with a newfound appreciation for the arts.

Los Angeles Arts District

Experience the creative energy of Los Angeles like never before at the LA Arts District – a cultural and artistic hub for seniors!

From cutting-edge galleries to colorful street art, It will take you on a journey through the heart of the district, showcasing hidden gems and local favorites.

With options tailored to meet different mobility needs, these adventures at Arts District guarantee a safe and exciting experience for seniors of all abilities.

California Science Museum

Untie your inner scientist and discover the wonders of the California Science Museum – a senior-friendly destination!

With interactive exhibits and mind-blowing experiences, you’ll journey through the mysteries of the universe, explore the depths of the oceans, and discover the secrets of the human body.

California Science Museum offers a fun and engaging experience with exhibits on space exploration, ecosystems, and technology. You can enjoy an interactive day of learning and discovery.

The Autry Museum of the American West

Get ready to celebrate the history and culture of the American West at the Autry Museum!

From legendary cowboys to iconic Native American artifacts, It will transport you back in time and immerse you in the rich culture of the West.

Explore this iconic museum’s untold stories and hidden gems with customized options to suit all mobility levels.

Plan to explore the region’s rich history and its influence on American culture

Don’t miss out on an unforgettable journey through the heart of the American West.

Getty Villa & Getty Center

One of the obvious mentions – the Getty Villa & Getty Center. Discover the ancient wonders of the Mediterranean and experience the heights of modern art there.

Dip yourself in the stunning architecture, exquisite gardens, and fascinating exhibitions of the Getty Villa, featuring over 44,000 works of art from ancient Greece, Rome, and Etruria. Or, venture to the Getty Center, a modern architectural masterpiece perched atop the Santa Monica mountains, showcasing some of the most iconic pieces of art from the 20th century.

The Bottom Line – Things to Do in LA for Seniors

Ready to unlock the hidden treasures of Los Angeles? Our blog on ‘Things to Do in Los Angeles for Seniors’ is your ultimate guide to an unforgettable adventure in the City of Angels.

Los Angeles is an ideal destination for seniors looking to enjoy a variety of activities, from art and culture to outdoor adventures and relaxing beach getaways.

With its mild climate and numerous senior-friendly attractions and senior home care services, LA ensures all mobility levels that seniors can have a comfortable and enjoyable experience while exploring the City of Angels.

Don’t wait to discover why LA is a must-visit destination for seniors. Get ready and experience the best of this vibrant city – your ultimate adventure awaits!

Things to Do in LA for Seniors – FAQs
